newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Ex-MOF official says dlr over 115 yen excessive.
newsitem.headline: Ex-MOF official says dlr over 115 yen excessive.

text.p: Former Japanese Vice Finance Minister Makoto Utsumi said on Wednesday that a rise in the dollar above 115 yen would be excessive, and said between 105 yen and 115 yen was a reasonable level.
He made the comments in an interview with Reuters Financial Television (RFTV).

Utsumi, now a professor at Japan's Keio University, also said a recent rally in the Japanese government bond market did not reflect the reality of the Japanese economy, which was recovering gradually.

"I think the institutional investors concentrating on purchasing Japanese government bonds have the assumption that the Japanese economy is growing only one percent or so. I think it does not reflect the reality. It's now the bubble price," he said. "If they continue to do that, misled by their own misunderstanding of the reality, I would predict they would have a loss," he said.

Referring to foreign exchange rates, Utsumi said: "If the yen weakens beyond 115, say 116, 117, I think it's excessive and the market should recognise this. A level between 105 yen and 115 yen is a reasonable range."
"I think both sides of the Pacific (Japan and the United States) would have a concern if the yen weakens excessively and if the dollar strengthens excessively beyond fundamentals," he said.
